results.title: Bill Nighy, Master of Misdirection
results.abstract: Though his turn in the drama “Living” is the subject of Oscar chatter, just try getting him to talk about his art. He prefers self-deprecation instead.

multimedia.caption: Kazuo Ishiguro wrote the part of Mr. Williams in “Living” specifically for Nighy: “To play that English person and add to it something profoundly, hauntingly human that isn’t just English, but universal — that’s something quite special,” the writer said.
multimedia.copyright: Ariel Fisher for The New York Times

multimedia.caption: Kazuo Ishiguro wrote the part of Mr. Williams in “Living” specifically for Nighy: “To play that English person and add to it something profoundly, hauntingly human that isn’t just English, but universal — that’s something quite special,” the writer said.
multimedia.copyright: Ariel Fisher for The New York Times

results.title: Critics Choice Awards 2023: The Complete Winners List
results.abstract: “Everything Everywhere All at Once” wins the top prize, while Brendan Fraser takes best actor for “The Whale” and Cate Blanchett triumphs for “Tár.”

results.title: ‘Saint Omer’ Review: The Trials of Motherhood
results.abstract: A real-life case of infanticide is the basis of Alice Diop’s rigorous and wrenching courtroom drama.

results.title: The Golden Globes Were Too Big to Fail
results.abstract: Did the awards get their legitimacy back? You can’t regain what you never had.

multimedia.caption: In his Golden Globes monologue, the host Jerrod Carmichael wrestled with his own complicity in legitimizing the awards.
In his Golden Globes monologue, the host Jerrod Carmichael wrestled with his own complicity in legitimizing the awards.

results.title: ‘Beautiful Beings’ Review: Boys Will Be Boys Will Be Violent Jerks
results.abstract: In this brutal Icelandic drama, four teenagers — both bullies and the bullied — struggle and rage against a world that rages back.

results.abstract: The film’s writer and director Nikyatu Jusu narrates a sequence.

results.title: Producers Guild Awards Nominate Several Blockbusters and Omit Films by Women
results.abstract: ‘Avatar: The Way of Water,” “Black Panther: Wakanda Forever” and “Top Gun: Maverick” made the cut. “The Woman King” and “Women Talking” were snubbed.
des_facet: Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery (Movie)

results.title: Gina Lollobrigida, Movie Star and Sex Symbol, Is Dead at 95
results.abstract: She began her career in her native Italy and, although she achieved fame in America worked more often in Europe. She later had a second career as an artist and filmmaker.

multimedia.caption: Gina Lollobrigida in the 1953 Italian-French comedy “Fanfan la Tulipe.” A year after it was released in the United States, she was on the cover of Time magazine.
Gina Lollobrigida in the 1953 Italian-French comedy “Fanfan la Tulipe.” A year after it was released in the United States, she was on the cover of Time magazine.

results.title: Edie Landau, Film Producer Who Was Ahead of Her Time, Dies at 95
results.abstract: She and her husband invented a model for faithfully adapting acclaimed literature, illuminating an alternate path for independent cinema.

multimedia.caption: The film producer Edie Landau with her husband and fellow producer, Ely Landau, left, and the director Ronald Neame in 1980.
The film producer Edie Landau with her husband and fellow producer, Ely Landau, left, and the director Ronald Neame in 1980.
The film producer Edie Landau with her husband and fellow producer, Ely Landau, left, and the director Ronald Neame in 1980.

results.title: Kevin Spacey Pleads Not Guilty to 7 Charges of Sexual Misconduct in U.K.
results.abstract: The Oscar-winning actor had already pleaded not guilty in July to five other counts of sexual misconduct. He is currently out on bail.

multimedia.caption: Kevin Spacey outside the Old Bailey in London last July.
Kevin Spacey outside the Old Bailey in London last July.

results.title: Five International Movies to Stream Now
results.abstract: This month’s picks include a Latvian satire about World War II, a family portrait by an Indian documentarian, an Oedipal thriller from Mexico and more.

results.title: For a Deadly Doll, a Killer Wardrobe
results.abstract: The titular star of the horror film “M3gan,” released last week, had to try on several outfits before finding a signature look.

results.title: Is Stephanie Hsu the ‘Dark Horse’ of Award Season?
results.abstract: The “Everything Everywhere All at Once” actress may not be as well known as her co-stars, but her role is crucial enough to deserve consideration.

multimedia.caption: “This industry is weird,” Stephanie Hsu said. There are moments when a famous actor congratulates you and “moments where you walk on a carpet and people are like, ‘Lana Condor, Lana Condor!’”
multimedia.copyright: Ryan Pfluger for The New York Times

results.title: SAG Award Nominations 2023: The Complete List, Snubs and Surprises
results.abstract: “The Banshees of Inisherin” and “Everything Everywhere All at Once” pick up important nods. Michelle Williams is shut out.

results.title: Several Golden Globe winners were not there to pick up their awards.
results.abstract: While some could not attend, citing conflicts, Kevin Costner was kept from the ceremony by the severe weather in California.

multimedia.caption: Kevin Costner was prevented from picking up his award for “Yellowstone” because of the storms in California.
Kevin Costner was prevented from picking up his award for “Yellowstone” because of the storms in California.
Kevin Costner was prevented from picking up his award for “Yellowstone” because of the storms in California.

results.title: Tarnished Golden Globes Return to TV, and Hollywood Plays Along
results.abstract: Amid a few awkward moments, the industry’s stars mostly embraced the chance to accept film and TV trophies in hopes of a bump in business and award-season momentum.

multimedia.caption: The stand-up comedian Jerrod Carmichael hosted the ceremony, often poking at its troubles.
The stand-up comedian Jerrod Carmichael hosted the ceremony, often poking at its troubles.
The stand-up comedian Jerrod Carmichael hosted the ceremony, often poking at its troubles.

results.title: Eddie Murphy receives the Cecil B. DeMille Award.
results.abstract: The award was given to Murphy, 61, for “outstanding contributions to the world of entertainment.”

multimedia.caption: Eddie Murphy accepting the Globe for his “outstanding contributions to the world of entertainment.”
Eddie Murphy accepting the Globe for his “outstanding contributions to the world of entertainment.”
Eddie Murphy accepting the Globe for his “outstanding contributions to the world of entertainment.”

results.title: Jennifer Coolidge Credits ‘White Lotus’ Creator for a ‘New Beginning’
results.abstract: Accepting a Golden Globe for her role as a needy heiress in the HBO dramedy, Coolidge delivered one of the most memorable speeches of the night.

multimedia.caption: Jennifer Coolidge won for her role in “The White Lotus.”
Jennifer Coolidge won for her role in “The White Lotus.”
Jennifer Coolidge won for her role in “The White Lotus.”

results.title: Michelle Yeoh wins her first Globe.
results.abstract: The actress won her first Golden Globe for her performance in “Everything Everywhere All at Once.” “It’s been an amazing journey, an incredible fight to be here today.”

multimedia.caption: Michelle Yeoh accepting the trophy.
Michelle Yeoh accepting the trophy.
Michelle Yeoh accepting the trophy.

results.title: Ke Huy Quan’s emotional journey.
results.abstract: The former child actor, now 51 and a star of “Everything Everywhere All at Once,” has been winning fans all awards season long.

multimedia.caption: Ke Huy Quan with his Golden Globe for best supporting actor.
Ke Huy Quan with his Golden Globe for best supporting actor.
Ke Huy Quan with his Golden Globe for best supporting actor.

results.title: Jerrod Carmichael quickly addresses the elephant in the room.
results.abstract: Noting that the group that gives out the Golden Globes had no Black members until recently, Jerrod Carmichael, the show’s host, said: “I’ll tell you why I’m here. I’m here ’cause I’m Black.”

multimedia.caption: Jerrod Carmichael addressing the crowd during his monologue.
Jerrod Carmichael addressing the crowd during his monologue.
Jerrod Carmichael addressing the crowd during his monologue.

results.title: Vatican Pledges to Look Into 1983 Disappearance of a Teenage Girl
results.abstract: Vatican officials said they would reopen a cold case that has gripped Italians, spawned countless theories and been the subject of a Netflix documentary series.

multimedia.caption: Pietro Orlandi, the brother of Emanuela Orlandi, a teenager who disappeared in 1983, stands with supporters, family and friends during a sit-in in 2020 in St. Peter’s Square. Their banner reads: “No state, or church can justify criminality. Truth for Emanuela Orlandi.”

Pietro Orlandi, the brother of Emanuela Orlandi, a teenager who disappeared in 1983, stands with supporters, family and friends during a sit-in in 2020 in St. Peter’s Square. Their banner reads: “No state, or church can justify criminality. Truth for Emanuela Orlandi.”

Pietro Orlandi, the brother of Emanuela Orlandi, a teenager who disappeared in 1983, stands with supporters, family and friends during a sit-in in 2020 in St. Peter’s Square. Their banner reads: “No state, or church can justify criminality. Truth for Emanuela Orlandi.”
